item.title: Highbrow Experience
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
Highbrow Experience's approach to travel is all about creating a unique, tailored experience. Their blog will cover cool spots in cities all around the world, complete with insider tips. You can also request a custom itinerary, fill out a detailed questionnaire on the site, and have them plan a trip for you.

The post Highbrow Experience appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
Highbrow Experience’s approach to travel is all about creating a unique, tailored experience. Their blog will cover cool spots in cities all around the world, complete with insider tips like all the different places you can stay at, they even mention Anna Tours for you to check out their business to see if they can find a place for you to stay. You can also request a custom itinerary, fill out a detailed questionnaire on the site, and have them plan a trip for you.

The post Highbrow Experience appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Launch: Planet Awesome Kid!
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We're very proud to introduce our latest and greatest web project, Planet Awesome Kid! The purpose of the site is to celebrate kids fashion in a fun and sweet way. We spent a lot of time getting the design perfected to giving the photography center stage; they have some killer photographers on board.

The post Launch: Planet Awesome Kid! appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We’re very proud to introduce our latest and greatest web project, Planet Awesome Kid! The purpose of the site is to celebrate kids fashion in a fun and sweet way. We spent a lot of time getting the design perfected to giving the photography center stage; they have some killer photographers on board.

If you’re in New York on March 20th, you might want to check out their event in partnership with Global Action for Children – we designed the invitation email as well.

The post Launch: Planet Awesome Kid! appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Planet Awesome Kid
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We just found out that we're going to be re-designing Planet Awesome Kid, the premiere kids street style blog dedicated to celebrating the individualism and spirit of children around the world.

The post Planet Awesome Kid appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We just redesigned the Planet Awesome Kid blog:

Here’s something we lifted from their about page to let you know what they are all about:

We can all learn a lot about true style and inner light from these kids. A child’s sense of self comes shining through in his or her style and what he or she chooses to wear. It is one of the most basic and instinctual ways that children show the world who they are. Whether they’ve dressed themselves or have been dressed by an equally awesome parent, we just love it. Babies, too, can be fashionmaticians!

Planet Awesome Kid recently partnered with Global Action For Children, (Angelina Jolie’s organization) and will be organizing an awesome charity event soon! Here’s the invitation we designed:

The post Planet Awesome Kid appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Show Latest Blog Posts on any PHP page
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
If you've ever used magpie to display your latest blog pages on a regular PHP page then you probably noticed at some point that your curly quotes don't show up properly, this is the code you can use to do it right.

The post Show Latest Blog Posts on any PHP page appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
You can use magpie to display your latest blog posts on any php page, so a site without a blog can still display posts from any blog that has an RSS feed. Magpie tutorials on the net usually don’t take into consideration quotes which we have here, so this should be all you need to get going.

Magpie & RSS

If you’ve come to this page you probably already use magpie, if not, magpie is an RSS parser that can be used to display your blog posts on any php page. You can get Magpie here

Complete Code

You don’t need to know what any of this stuff means really, just change path/that/points/to/magpie/rss_fetch.inc to be the actual path to that file on your server, set the $url variable to point to your RSS feed, and $num_items sets the number of posts you want to see.

<dl>
<?php 
define('MAGPIE_INPUT_ENCODING', 'UTF-8');					
define('MAGPIE_OUTPUT_ENCODING', 'UTF-8');					
require_once 'path/that/points/to/magpie/rss_fetch.inc';

$url = 'http://feeds.mimoymima.com/mym-news?format=xml';
$num_items = 5;							
$rss = fetch_rss($url);
$rss->items = array_slice($rss->items, 0, $num_items);


foreach ($rss->items as $item ) {
$title = $item[title];
$link = $item[link];
$description = $item[description];
$pubdate = $item[pubdate];

$title = htmlentities($title, ENT_QUOTES, 'UTF-8');
$link = htmlentities($link, ENT_QUOTES, 'UTF-8');

preg_match('/[0-9]+/', $pubdate, $pubDay);
preg_match('/[A-Za-z]+s/', $pubdate, $pubMonth);
preg_match('/[0-9]{4}/', $pubdate, $pubYear);

$shortDate = "$pubMonth[0]" . "$pubDay[0], " . "$pubYear[0]";

echo "<dt><a href="$link" class="Popup">$title</a></dt>";
echo "<dd class="PubDate">$shortDate</dd>";
echo "<dd class="Description">$description</dd>";

} ?>

</dl>

The Curly Quote Fixes

If you already use magpie to display your blog posts and just need to fix your quotes, then you would just add these pieces from the code above to your code:

define('MAGPIE_INPUT_ENCODING', 'UTF-8');					
define('MAGPIE_OUTPUT_ENCODING', 'UTF-8');

and

$title = htmlentities($title, ENT_QUOTES, 'UTF-8');
$link = htmlentities($link, ENT_QUOTES, 'UTF-8');

If you run PHP5 on your server, it comes with it’s own simple to use parser called SimpleXML which you could use instead of magpie, we’ll show you how to do that in a future article, so subscribe to our feed if you want to be notified.

The post Show Latest Blog Posts on any PHP page appeared first on mimoYmima.
